string.text: Incendiary ammunition is loaded with a Barium and Aluminum compound in the forward portion of the projectile. When the projectile strikes a relatively solid object, it detonates with a bright flash at approximately 3000F to ignite combustible material. Caution must be exercised when firing these rounds to prevent accidental brush fires.
A lengthened .44 Special case, loaded to higher pressures for greater velocity.
Hunting crossbow equipped with an optical sight. Silent weapon with good striking power and accuracy.
Imported Chinese steel core ammunition that has improved penetration against body armor.
Standard army 7.62x39 ammunition. It packs a mean punch and is cheap and plentiful, since army supplies tend to 'fall off trucks'.
A standard round for the Colt 1911 and the SiG-Sauer P220 pistols. It has a standard core and a full-jacketed bullet.
An Hydro-Shock round with improved characteristics for the Colt 1911 and the SiG-Sauer P220 pistols. It has a hollow-point bullet with a good stopping effect.

A standard 12 caliber round filled with 6 mm shot. It has an enormous killing power at a close range. It is designed for the TOZ-66, the Mossberg 88 and the SPAS-12 shotguns. It is most effective at ranges under 30 meters.
A standard 12 caliber round filled with large #00 buckshot. It has a better armor penetration ability than smaller buckshot. It is most effective at ranges under 40 meters.

A finned bullet. It can stabilize in flight, which increases its accuracy. It is designed for the TOZ-34, the TOZ-66, Mossberg 88 and the SPAS-12 shotguns. It has an armor-piercing effect and an increased range. It is effective at a range of up to 150 meters.

A round with a heavy naked bullet. It is usually used for big game hunting, but can be used for other purposes. Its heavy bullet does not pierce but actually forces itself through bulletproof vests. It is designed for the TOZ-34, the TOZ-66, the Mossberg 88 and the SPAS-12 shotguns. It is effective at a range of up to 100 meters.
A round with a heavy naked bullet with a higher piercing effect specially created for shotguns with modified or rifled barrels.
An armor-piercing round for the AKS-74, the AKS-74U and the AN-94 assault rifles. It has an improved armor-piercing effect, but a decreased stopping effect.
A standard round for the AKS-74, the AKS-74U and the Obokan assault rifles. It has a standard core and a full-jacketed bullet.
A round with an armor-piercing bullet for the L85A1, the LR-300ML, the SG-550, the G36 and the F2000 assault rifles.
A standard NATO round widely-known under its Belgian SS109 index. It is used with the L85A1, the LR-300ML, the SG-550, the G36 and the F2000 assault rifles.
A standard NATO round widely-known under its Belgian SS109 index. Used with the FN P90 assault rifles.
A cheap modification of the sniper round for the SVD, SVU sniper rifles.
A sniper round for the SVD and the SVU sniper rifles. It has an improved accuracy and range.
A round with an armor-piercing bullet for the SVD and the SVU sniper rifles.
It's rim ammunition with so that "R" shows it by 7.62mm x 54R bullet for PKM machine guns (the bottom of the cartridge sticks out than the cartridge)
A standard round for the PM, PB-6P9, Fort-12 pistols. It has a standard core and a full-jacketed bullet. It has a weak armor-piercing effect.
A round with a Jacketed Soft Point - Armor Piercing bullet. Allows for much better armor piercing without losing any stopping power.

A round with improved ballistic characteristics for the PM, the PB-6P9 and the Fort-12 pistols. Due to the high initial velocity of its bullet, it is much more effective then a standard round. It has a slightly better armor-piercing effect.
A standard round for the Walther P99 pistol and the MP5A3 submachine gun. It has a full-jacketed bullet with a weak armor-piercing effect.
An improved round for the Walther P99 and the MP5A3 submachine gun. A high-powered round with a hollow-point bullet and an armor-piercing core.

An armor-piercing round for the OTs-14-4A Groza and the AS Val assault rifles and for the VSS Vintorez special sniper rifle. It has a subsonic bullet which due to its special design can penetrate most bulletproof vests at a range of up to 400 meters.

A round for the OTs-14-4A Groza and the AS Val assault rifles and the VSS Vintorez special sniper rifle. The later and cheaper modification of the armor-piercing round. It has a subsonic bullet which due to its special design can penetrate most bulletproof vests at a range of up to 300 meters.

A sniper round for the OTs-14-4A Groza and the AS Val assault rifles and the VSS Vintorez special sniper rifle. It has a subsonic bullet which due to its heavy weight and special design can penetrate most bulletproof vests at a range of up to 400 meters.
Energy cells prepared with lethal elements in a Gauss rifle magazine. The energy source is an encapsulated piece of the Flash artifact.
A grenade for the M203 grenade launcher (for the LR-300ML, G36, SG-550, L85A1 rifles) and the integrated grenade launcher of the F2000.
A highly-explosive grenade for the RPG-7V. It is equally effective against troops and light armored vehicles.
A grenade for the GP-25 grenade launcher, the integrated grenade launcher of the Groza, and the RG-6 revolver grenade launcher.

A grenade for the GP-25 grenade launcher, the integrated grenade launcher of the OTs-14-4A Groza and the RG-6 revolver grenade launcher. Prior explosion the grenade leaps up about one meter increasing its killing effect.
A defensive hand grenade with a large radius of splinter damage. It is recommended to throw it only from behind cover.
A smoke grenade. Dedicated to create a smoke screen. Lasts for 10 seconds.
An offensive hand grenade with a small radius of splinter damage.

A .44 Magnum revolver, 'liberated' from the cold, dead hands of the bandit leader, Borov. One can see 'KHUI' crudely carved into the handle. One can wonder what the author of this inscription meant...

The weapon of the elite troops in the Russian army. It was designed as a replacement for the outdated AKS-74. Not only the Obokan's internal mechanisms but also its receiver and its barrel are movable, which decreases the recoil and increases accuracy.
Machine gun supplied with a modified optic sight for carrying out sniper fire. The optics embedded into the body of the weapon has a higher resolution than the standard model.
Given machine gun has an integral grenade launcher to go under the barrel, which makes this an even more universal weapon.
A grenade launcher for the AKS-74 and AKS-74U.
A grenade launcher for the SG-550, the LR-300ML, the G36 and the L85A1.
A widely used Soviet scope. The scope can be mounted on a weapon using a dovetail mount used by the Warsaw Pact countries.
A 4x scope produced in the NATO countries. It can be attached to a standard NATO mount, also called the Picatinny rail.
An effective silencer made by Zone gunsmiths. The kit includes a set of adapters for weapons of any caliber.
A silencer for pistols using .44 or .45 cal rounds.
A silencer for rifles using 5.45 mm USSR rounds.
A silencer for rifles using 5.56 mm NATO rounds.
A silencer for rifles using 7.62x39 rounds.
A silencer for pistols using 9x18 or 9x19 mm rounds.
A silencer for rifles using 9x39 mm rounds.

Assault rifle with a folding butt, 1974 model, uses 5.45x39 mm ammunition. It is a simple and reliable weapon, but the cheapness of its production affected its ergonomics and accuracy. In the Zone, it is the main weapon of the military stalkers and of many solo fighters.
A very old and rusty AK which, perhaps, will survive its latest shootout.
The modified closing system increases the speed of shooting.

The weight and size of the AKS-74U are similar to those of a submachine gun, but its operation mode and the ammunition it uses place it into the class of the assault rifles. Its advantages are its small dimensions very useful when fighting inside a building or in a thick forest and a relatively high piercing capabilities. Its main disadvantages are a limited accuracy range and quick overheating when firing bursts.
Enhanced machine gun. Comes with a non-replaceable muffler.

An upgrade of the classic Soviet assault rifle, now equipped with a folding stock. It uses 7.62x39 mm ammunition. It is a simple and reliable weapon, but the cheapness of its production affected its ergonomics and accuracy. Rarely seen in the Zone because of the surplus of its newer models.
Modification of AKM for sniping. Much more precisely than ordinary counterpart, but it shoots only single shots. The optics embedded into the body of the weapon.

Adopted by the American army and police, as well as many military and police units all over the world. It is also very popular among the criminals for its high-powered round and its high-capacity magazine.
A sawn-off TOZ-66 rifle. It is lighter and more compact then the original two-barrel rifle, but it is effective only at a close range. One of the weapons most commonly used by beginners.
The original TOZ-66 rifle. Heavy and dangerous two barrel rifle, and its effective in high range too.
Weapon of hired assassins. Good old reliable kora, comes with a non-replaceable muffler.

A nice gun, which was presented in all the conflicts of the 20th century with honor and entered the new century with confidence. Its small-size magazine is partially compensated by the use of a high-powered round.
A real gun for real heroes. It is big, heavy and very destructive. It is not very popular in the Zone due to its price and size. After all, you don't go hunting for elephants every day!
An assault rifle combined with a grenade launcher. It is equipped with an electronic fire control module and a 40-mm grenade launcher.
An assault rifle combined with a grenade launcher. It is equipped with an electronic fire control module and a 40-mm grenade launcher.
A police pistol of Ukrainian production, replaced the PM. In comparison with the other pistols, it has improved accuracy, ergonomics and a larger magazine, but it is less reliable.
Experimental prototype of the Fort pistol.
A German assault rifle. It is a first-grade specimen of the modern weaponry: it is light, reliable, and ergonomic.

A super-accurate weapon made by the scientists in the Zone. It is almost noiseless, because instead of gunpowder, it uses the artifact's energy for firing rather than steam gases. In spite of the Gauss gun's tremendous firepower, the recoil is insignificant. The accuracy and the killing power of this gun exceed those of all other small arms.

An assault rifle combined with a grenade launcher. It is a very good type of assault rifle for the Zone conditions: it is compact, reliable, but universal and powerful. The OTs-14-4A Groza is one of the favorite rifles of the military stalkers.
Version of an assault rifle for regular army 7.62x39 mm cartridges. As a result, has higher ammo capacity and higher stopping power.
Personal Thunder of a major from the Institute. It has self-made improvements and an expanded magazine. Valuable and useful thing in the Zone.

A custom Groza variant made for the commander of the Agroprom Research Institute. Besides being rechambered to a more common round, it features the ability to use bigger magazines, and with its mechanisms strengthened for the harsh conditions of the Zone.
This pistol deserves to be considered as one of the best pistols of the 20th century. It is reliable, powerful and has a good grouping of shots. The magazine can hold 13 rounds.

After the British army replaced this rifle with the German-made G36, it appeared in large quantities first on the black market and then in the Zone. The L85A1's main advantages are a standard 4x scope and the high accuracy of the first shot. In burst mode, its accuracy decreases greatly, and the main mechanisms of the rifle are not reliable enough.
With a few modifications the effect of the throwing up of the barrel was diminished
Weapon comes with an integrated muffler. Many parts are replaced with lighter analogues, which makes the weapon significantly lighter.

A light rifle with an effective fire range of up to 300 meters. Due its to exceptionally easy triggering, high ergonomics and low weight, the weapon is highly accurate, though it is too sensitive to dirt and is not always suitable for use under difficult field conditions.
A modification of the assault rifle with an integrated silencer and scope. Restricted to single shots only it was designed as a cheaper alternative to a real marksman rifle.
A unique modification of weapons for assault objectives. It has an integrated grenade launcher, increased reliability, accuracy and even a little reliability
The famous Mosin-Nagant rifle created back in the Russian Empire was also used in USSR until 1965.
Not as good as the modern versions, but it still does the job.

One of the best weapons in the submachine gun class. During the last decades of the 20th century it was adopted by the army and police special forces units in many countries. When it was gradually replaced with more up-to-date models, it appeared on the black market, and then in the Zone.
Light, compact, and now redone to fit a more wide-spread caliber, this machine gun is a true find for beginning shooters.
A variation on a basic model. A non-replaceable muffler is added.

The P90 is a Belgian personal defense weapon developed between 1986-1987 at Fabrique Nationale de Herstal. The weapon's name is an abbreviation of Project, and the number 90 specifies a weapon system of the 1990s.\n
A pistol with an integrated silencer, it was used by Soviet special forces. It is now outdated, but in skillful hands, still very effective.

The PKM is a general purpose machine gun designed in the Soviet Union. The PKM machine gun was introduced in the 1960s and replaced the SGM and RPD machine guns in Soviet service. PKM can be used as a light anti-aircraft weapon when it is put on an AA mount. One feature typical to Soviet machine guns is that the standard model feeds from the right and ejects its rounds via an ejection port on the left side of the weapon, as opposed to the usual right side ejection port seen in most western machine guns.

The most widespread pistol in the Zone. It is a legacy of the Soviet era. It is relatively reliable and cheap, has low magazine capacity, low power and an unsatisfactory grouping of shots. It is the main weapon of a beginning stalker.

A revolver-type grenade launcher. Sometimes, it is just indispensable, particularly when targeting large numbers of mutants, attacking well-guarded stationary objects or fighting especially tough creatures.
A variation of the revolving grenade launcher. The given model is made especially for use of grenades of the western model.

A grenade launcher developed in the 1960s. Such grenade launchers are stored in large quantities in army depots, from where they are transferred to the Zone. Such weapon is rare for stalkers: its huge dimensions and heavy weight make it unpopular, though it is indispensable for some missions.

The weapon was made for warfare in the city. To lessen the weight, some parts were removed or replaced. As a result, there is no way to attach neither a sight nor a grenade launcher under the barrel. But at least it weighs almost half of what it did before.
Modified for sniper fire. Furnished with a non-removeable optical sight of heightened focus.

A model developed back in 1975 but still popular all around the world. Its magazine has low capacity, but its mechanism is absolutely reliable. Its second advantage is the use of the high-powered Kora round.
A relatively new assault rifle for the 5.56x45 mm SS109 round. This weapon is very popular due to its accuracy, soft recoil, and high reliability.

The SPAS-12 smooth-bore rifle was developed in the late 1970th. This weapon is very reliable and flexibly used. It is however relatively big, expensive and its mechanism is too complex. Probably, this is the best close range gun in the Zone.
This shotgun model has a rifled bore which greatly increases its accuracy when firing darts or slugs. However, using shot is more difficult.

This rifle was widely used in all operations of the Soviet and Russian armies since 1960. It proved itself to be an exceptionally reliable and handy weapon. In the Zone it is preferred by the experienced stalkers of the Duty faction which hunt mutants.
Improved optics, and thanks to the change the resolution of the image is increased. The balance in the weapon is increased, and as a result the recoil is decreased.
A more up-to-date version of the sniper rifle. A compact bullpup model. It is excellent for long trips in the Zone.
This hunting rifle is popular but there's nothing noteworthy about it.
A reliable weapon. As a quality compact close-range weapon, it is very popular among the Zone veterans.

This weapon is based on the VSS Vintorez noiseless sniper rifle, but it has a folding butt, can fire bursts and has a larger magazine. It was originally designed for special forces operating in conditions demanding noiseless and flameless fire.
Differs from the basic model in integrated electronic optical sights.

A special sniper rifle designed for noiseless and flameless sniper fire and equipped with an integrated silencer. It can pierce any bulletproof vest at a range of 400 meters. It is a weapon highly valued by stalkers of any level.
An excellent pistol. Highly reliable with a high capacity magazine and a good fire accuracy, especially in the case of the model designed for the 9 mm FMJ round.
Modification of the gun for ability to use bullets of the 9x18mm caliber.
An smooth-bore pump-action rifle made for use in the most hostile environment. It is very reliable. All its details are covered with anticorrosive coating.
Variation of the Winchester. A small fragment of the artifact "Gravi" was built into the barrel, positioned in such a way as to increase the speed of the bullet's flight.
A Fort-12 with a personal engraving. Belongs to Major Griboyedov.
A common Soviet-made 5.0x fixed zoom optical scope with a range scale. Attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount, which is standard in Warsaw Pact countries.

A 2.0x fixed zoom optical scope with a built-in heat visor used to identify heat sources typical of the human body. Designed for use by special forces. Attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount.
An image intensifier night vision 2.0x fixed zoom scope for combat in darkness. Attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount.
An adjustable long-range 1.6x-4x zoom scope that can use automatic adjustment to provide greater fire effectiveness. Attached to weapons by means of the NATO-standard Picatinny rail.
A 4x fixed zoom scope produced primarily in Western countries. Attached to weapons by means of the NATO-standard Picatinny rail. Often used for accurate fire from small arms at medium to long range.
An optical ACOG 1.6x higher contrast scope for combat in reduced lighting conditions. Attached to weapons by means of the NATO-standard Picatinny rail.
A 4.0x fixed zoom scope with a night vision device for long range combat in darkness. Attached to weapons by means of the NATO-standard Picatinny rail.
An optical ACOG 1.6x scope for combat at short to medium range. Attached to weapons by means of the NATO-standard Picatinny rail.
A variable zoom sniper scope. Attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount.
A 2.7x optical scope for urban combat at medium range. Attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount.
Modified by a mechanic version of a powerful gun. This model has better accuracy, less weight and is equipped with a more capacious clip. Truly a killing machine for close-range combat.
A gun that is already powerful, reworked to fit rifle bullets. Truly a killing machine for close-range combat.

This weapon was previously owned by Zulu. Its special features include an enlarged ammo box and a particularly reliable retracting mechanism design. The modifications meant an increase in the weapon's weight, but that wasn't a problem for the last owner.

This belt-fed machine gun is a portable modification with a complex two-stage feeding system. Despite its weight and low precision, this LMG has found admirers in the Zone. Used primarily to fight off outnumbering enemy forces during faction conflicts and clear out mutant lairs.

The .44 Magnum is based on a lengthened .44 Special case, loaded to higher pressures for greater velocity (and thus, energy).\nThe .44 Magnum has since been eclipsed in power by the .454 Casull, among others;\nnevertheless, it has remained one of the most popular commercial large-bore magnum cartridges.
Raging Bull handguns are still a favorite among hunting enthusiasts. Chambering the popular and powerful .44 Magnum rounds, the mighty Raging Bull revolver is built for a lifetime of tough use.
A special, experimental model of the Fort-15. Thanks to changes in the internal mechanisms, it can now fire in full-auto mode. To make such a fire rate viable, the magazine was also enlarged.
Full sized power in a small design. This wheelgun delivers superior accuracy and stopping power without the heft or bulk of most .44 Magnum revolvers.
A silencer for rifles using 7.62x54 rounds.
This 4.0x fixed zoom optical scope was designed specifically for the bullpup assault rifle OTs-14 Groza.
A Fort-12 with a personal engraving. Belongs to Major Griboyedov.
The standard armor piercing cartridge for the FN P90 and FN Five-Seven.
5.7x28 caliber hollow-point round. Has increased stopping power.
Standard 7.62x51 caliber ammunition for NATO weapons.
7.62x51 caliber armor piercing rounds. Dedicated for NATO sniper rifles.

.338 Lapua Magnum (8.6x70 mm) caliber armor piercing round. It was created as a special sniper cartridge for shooting at great distances, but at the moment it is also widely used by hunters and shooters by sportsmen.
The "Shrapnel-10" is a 8,5 mm buckshot round of 23mm caliber, designed specially to be fired from the KS-23 Special Carbine. It has a devastating punch, albeit at a very short range (10 meters).
The "Shrapnel-10" is a 8,5 mm buckshot round of 23mm caliber, designed specially to be fired from the KS-23 Special Carbine. It has a devastating punch, albeit at a very short range (10 meters).
The "Shrapnel-25" is a 8,5 mm buckshot round of 23mm caliber, designed specially to be fired from the KS-23 Special Carbine. It has a devastating punch, albeit at a short range (25 meters).
"Barricade" ammo cartridge with solid steel projectile. Used to destroy the engine block of a car by its damaging at up to 100 meters.
USAS-12 - automatic shotgun, developed by John Trevor in the late 1980s on the basis of the ideas of another American designer Maxwell Atchisson, who created Atchisson Assault Shotgun.
Saiga-12K, a semi-automatic smoothbore shotgun. Many parts are borrowed from the Kalashnikov assault rifle.

The Vepr-12 is a Russian smoothbore, semi-auto shotgun, developed on the basis of the construction of a Kalashnikov machine gun. Designed for hunting, sports competitions, self-defense, and also as a service weapon. Is a direct competitor to the guns of the 'Saiga-12' series.

This assault rifle is made in accordance with the traditional layout scheme and constructively largely repeats the Kalashnikov assault rifle. The gun is designed for 5.45x39 mm caliber cartridges, there are also variants of this machine for the 5.56 mm NATO cartridge (AEK-972) and 7.62x39 mm (AEK-973).
AEK assault rifle variant for 7.62x39mm caliber. A perfect replacement for outdated AKM rifles.
The English-made sniper rifle developed by Accuracy International.

Semi-automatic pistol, designed and manufactured by the Belgian company Fabrique Nationale of Herstal. The name is a combination, on the one hand Five-seveN is "5-7", the caliber, and on the other the first and last letter of the name, written in capital letters, is an abbreviation of Fabrique Nationale.

A 5.56x45 mm caliber machine gun manufactured by Fabrique Nationale (Belgium), serial production began in the 1980s. The development of this weapon was given to the prospective designer Ernest Verviere, the creator of the FN MAG machine gun.

A 7.62x51 mm caliber machine gun manufactured by Fabrique Nationale (Belgium), serial production began in the 1980s. The development of this weapon was given to the prospective designer Ernest Verviere, the creator of the FN MAG machine gun.

FN P90 - Belgian submachine gun (personal self-defense weapon), developed in 1986 - 1987 by FN Herstal. It was developed, first of all, for tankmen and drivers of military vehicles and cars. Has a progressive and convenient ergonomic design. Specially for the P90, a 5.7x28 mm SS190 cartridge was developed, which has a high punching power and a low ricochet chance.

The OTs-33 Pernach is a Russian automatic pistol developed in the mid-1990s by a team of designers at the TsKIB SOO under the guidance of I. Ya. Stechkin for replacing the APS gun. At the development stage, the weapon was named AP SLZ-2 ("automatic pistol construction I.Ya. Stechkin, A.V. Balzer, A.V. Zinchenko").

PP-19 "Bison" - submachine, model 19, developed in 1993 by V.M. Kalashnikov (the son of the designer M.T. Kalashnikov) and Alexei Dragunov (son of E.F. Dragunov), commissioned by the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia).

The American sniper rifle manufactured by Barrett Firearms. Like the predecessor - the Barrett M98 (and never passed into the series rifle), the Bravo model is designed for the .338 Lapua Magnum cartridge.
Galil is an Israeli submachine gun designed by Yisrael Galil on the basis of the Finnish Valmet Rk 62, which in turn was a variant of the Kalashnikov assault rifle.

Steyr AUG (Armee Universal Gewehr - army universal rifle) - a small arms system, issued in 1977 by the Austrian company Steyr-Daimler-Puch. In this rifle, the bullpup layout scheme is uses, in which the magazine is located behind the fire control switch and trigger.

FN SCAR (eng. Special Operations Forces Combat Assault Rifle) is a weapon system developed by the American division of the Belgian company FN Herstal to participate in the competition to create a new USSOCOM machine gun in 2004. This model is designed for shooting cartridges of the 7.62x51mm caliber
The 7.62-mm semi-automatic Simonov carbine (SKS, GRAU index 56-A-231, also known as SKS-45 abroad) is a Soviet semi-automatic carbine designed by Sergei Simonov, adopted in 1949.

KS-23 (Special Carbine 23mm)  Soviet pump-action shotgun with rifled 23mm-diameter barrel. According to official classification, this weapon falls into "small-caliber artillery" category. Nothing and nobody can withstand the firepower of KS-23.

The RPK (Ruchnoy Pulemyot Kalashnikova) is a 7.62mm light machine gun of Soviet design, developed in the late 1950s, parallel with the AKM assault rifle. Good for cleaning up the territory from mutants.

5.45mm RPK-74M (Ruchnoy Pulemyot Kalashnikova modernizirovany, GRAU index 6P39), modernized version of light machine gun RPK-74. Good for cleaning up the territory from mutants. It is possible to improve up to four-row magazine for 60 rounds.

The Stechkin automatic pistol is a Soviet selective fire machine pistol. It bears the name of its developer, Igor Stechkin. The pistol form factor, automatic fire-capability, and powerful ammunition make it a deadly weapon for those able to control the recoil.

The Mosin-Nagant is a five-shot, bolt-action, internal magazine-fed, military rifle developed from 1882 to 1891, and used by the armed forces of the Russian Empire, the Soviet Union and various other nations. It is one of the most mass-produced military bolt-action rifles in history with over 37 million units having been made since its inception in 1891, and, in spite of its age, it has been used in various conflicts around the world even up to the modern day.
The SR-25 (Stoner Rifle-25) is a designated marksman rifle designed by Eugene Stoner and manufactured by Knight's Armament Company.
HK UMP (Universale Maschinenpistole - universal SMG) is a submachine gun developed and manufactured by Heckler and Koch in 1990's as a successor to the HK MP5.
Reworked by some madman submachine gun HK UMP45 for .44 rounds. Enormous recoil, very low reliability, silencer incompatibility - all this more than compensates for the huge damage.
A silencer for SR-25 and Galil, caliber 7.62x51.
A silencer for FN Five-Seven and FN P90, caliber 5.7x28.
Soviet optical sight, originally created in 1940, for joint use with a sniper version of a semi-automatic rifle by Tokarev (SVT-40). The sight is in demand now.
Optical sight for IMI Galil rifle.
An adjustable optical sight for IMI Galil rifle with a built-in heat visor.
An adjustable optical sight for IMI Galil rifle with a built-in nightvision device.
Simple bayonet knife borrowed from an AK rifle. Fairly good choice for a beginner.
Old axe, serving as a good helper to its previous owner who used to live in these parts. Due to the bulkiness, it's rarely used by stalkers in long trips.
Old kitchen knife with a dull blade. Such knives are mostly used by rookies - due to the cheapness and accessibility.
Jackknives are mostly used by stalkers for opening canned food. One can be still used in combat, however, the small blade makes it's almost useless. Very comfortable when held in hands.

Made by local stalkers using any available materials, this knife, despite the appearance, has a big blade which can be very convenient in a battle. Not really comfortable due to the big weight, but it still is a good choice for a beginner. Increased defeat range.

This massive knife - a rude and absolutely unbreakable multipurpose tool - lets you not only cut surprisingly good, but also chop, prick, and open ammo boxes - yet these are not all the things it is suitable for. Increased defeat range.
Just a slicer for cutting meat. A rare thing to be found in the Zone.

People say crowbar is the best tool for breaking locks and opening doors - and they say it not without reason. Not a rare thing to be found in industrial areas. Some stalkers use it as a melee weapon against small mutants, while bandits use it to execute tortures. It's widespread, yet not a popular weapon to be used. Increased defeat range.
This old and rusty shovel was carefully put into operation by some master. While it's usually used as intended, some treat it as a melee weapon.

Simple iron hammer with a wooden grip which is frequently found in the Zone's industrial areas. Despite its weight, stalkers often hold such a tool in their backpacks due to the amount of things a hammer can help with.
Old pickaxe found in a mine of the Zone. Doesn't have any special perks.
Small sapper shovel is an engineer tool. It's often used as a melee weapon: to prick, hash, and throw.
Empty vodka bottle, still useful as a weapon.
Tomahawk - a rude and absolutely unbreakable multipurpose tool, a formidable weapon in the zone, with the help of it you can punch an exoskeleton. Easy to use due to its weight balancing.
